author: Kathleen Winsor

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: John Mainwaring goes away to school and travels in Europe, falls in love with Judith, and they plan to get married, but their plans are disrupted by the outbreak of the civil war.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Judith and John continue to be separated by the civil war, but they remain deeply in love and determined to be together, finding ways to communicate and secretly meet, cherishing their time together and hoping for the war to end soon so they can finally be married.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber is devastated when she realizes that Bruce is leaving to sail in an hour, and he coldly gives her instructions on how to manage without him, leaving her stunned and paralyzed.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber copes with Bruce's departure and embraces her new life in London, navigating the challenges of being a single mother and finding her own path in a world full of uncertainty.

Amber, a young woman, convinces Lord Almsbury to take her to London. They arrive in the city and experience the excitement surrounding the return of King Charles II. Amber undergoes a transformation in appearance and meets various influential people. She attends social events and encounters both admiration and jealousy. Amber's relationship with Bruce becomes strained when he reveals he cannot marry her. Frustrated and angry, Amber decides to distance herself from Bruce and focuses on her own future.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber desperately pleads with Bruce not to leave her, but he eventually forces himself away and leaves her devastated. The scene then shifts to the Duke of York and King Charles II discussing James' marriage to Anne Hyde.

author: Kathleen Winsor

text: James agrees to marry Anne Hyde, causing anger and tears from the Chancellor and Anne herself. The Duke of Gloucester unexpectedly dies, casting a shadow over the court, but the extravagant celebrations of the Restoration persist.
recaptext: A woman gives birth to a baby girl and becomes disappointed. John Mainwaring falls in love with Judith, but their plans to marry are disrupted by the civil war. Judith receives a letter offering her safety, but her mother refuses to leave. Judith leaves home disguised as John's wife and finds refuge in a farmhouse. Amber St. Clare encounters a group of well-dressed men and catches the attention of Lord Almsbury. She meets Lord Carlton and they discuss the return of the King. Amber eagerly waits for Lord Carlton at the fair, but he doesn't arrive on time. They escape to a secluded meadow and engage in a passionate encounter. Amber, a young woman, convinces Lord Almsbury to take her to London. They arrive in the city and experience the excitement surrounding the return of King Charles II. Amber undergoes a transformation in appearance and meets various influential people. She attends social events and encounters both admiration and jealousy. Amber's relationship with Bruce becomes strained when he reveals he cannot marry her. Frustrated and angry, Amber decides to distance herself from Bruce and focuses on her own future. Amber is devastated when she realizes that Bruce is leaving to sail in an hour, and he coldly gives her instructions on how to manage without him, leaving her stunned and paralyzed. Amber desperately pleads with Bruce not to leave her, but he eventually forces himself away and leaves her devastated. The scene then shifts to the Duke of York and King Charles II discussing James' marriage to Anne Hyde.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Queen Mother Henrietta Maria arrives at the Court and meets with her son James, discussing rumors about him and Anne Hyde's relationship.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Queen Mother Henrietta Maria secures a pension for herself and negotiates a suitable dowry for her daughter Henrietta Anne's marriage to Philippe, Duc d'Orléans.

text: Minette and Philippe's marriage becomes strained as his true nature is revealed. Minette longs for a different life in France and contemplates leaving Philippe.

author: Kathleen Winsor

Amber's abusive husband, Luke, violently attacks her, causing her to fear for her unborn child, but Sally intervenes and helps Amber recover.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber's abusive husband, Luke, leaves her alone in an inn after a violent encounter, causing her to feel angry, lonely, and desperate to return to London.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber borrows a horse from the innkeeper and sets off with his son. As they ride through the rain-soaked streets, Amber's hatred for Luke intensifies, and she promises herself that she will seek revenge for his actions.

Amber St. Clare encounters a group of well-dressed men and catches the attention of Lord Almsbury. She meets Lord Carlton and they discuss the return of the King. Amber eagerly waits for Lord Carlton at the fair, but he doesn't arrive on time. They escape to a secluded meadow and engage in a passionate encounter. Amber, a young woman, convinces Lord Almsbury to take her to London. They arrive in the city and experience the excitement surrounding the return of King Charles II. Amber undergoes a transformation in appearance and meets various influential people. She attends social events and encounters both admiration and jealousy. Amber's relationship with Bruce becomes strained when he reveals he cannot marry her. Frustrated and angry, Amber decides to distance herself from Bruce and focuses on her own future. Amber is devastated when she realizes that Bruce is leaving to sail in an hour, and he coldly gives her instructions on how to manage without him, leaving her stunned and paralyzed. Amber desperately pleads with Bruce not to leave her, but he eventually forces himself away and leaves her devastated. The scene then shifts to the Duke of York and King Charles II discussing James' marriage to Anne Hyde. The Duke of York and King Charles II discuss James' marriage to Anne Hyde, with Charles advising James to marry her despite the objections of the Chancellor. Queen Mother Henrietta Maria arrives at the Court and meets with her son James, discussing rumors about him and Anne Hyde's relationship. Minette and her brother Charles discuss her upcoming marriage to Philippe, with Charles expressing concern about Philippe's true intentions. They continue to walk and talk, with Minette expressing her desire to marry Philippe and live in France. Henrietta Maria receives her daughter-in-law, Anne Hyde, in her opulent bedchamber at Whitehall, where they exchange pleasantries and Anne displays courageous grandeur in the face of her mother-in-law's disapproval. Amber, feeling lonely and eager to be part of the world, goes out in London and meets a friendly woman named Mrs. Goodman who offers to accompany her to the fashionable 'Change. Amber meets a friendly woman named Mrs. Goodman who offers to accompany her to the fashionable 'Change in London. They explore the Royal Exchange, attracting attention from men, and Amber becomes excited by the sights and sounds. Amber and Mrs. Goodman go to the Royal Exchange in London, where Amber witnesses a horrifying scene of a woman being beaten in public. Amber feels guilty and realizes the consequences of her own actions. Amber and Mrs. Goodman become close friends and spend their time together, going on outings and shopping in London. Mrs. Goodman tells Amber about her nephew, Luke Channell, who is smitten with Amber and invites her to the Mulberry Gardens. Amber marries Luke Channell, but quickly realizes he is crude, violent, and disrespectful towards her. She feels trapped between Luke and his aunt, Sally, who seem to have gained an advantage over her. Amber's money is slowly disappearing, causing her to feel fearful and hopeless in her marriage to Luke. She contemplates harming him but is also worried about her pregnancy being discovered. Amber's abusive husband, Luke, violently attacks her, causing her to fear for her unborn child, but Sally intervenes and helps Amber recover. Sally accuses Luke of stealing her money, causing tension between them. Amber wakes up to find a seemingly contented atmosphere in the room, with Luke trying to make amends by offering her a bracelet.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber, having lost all her money, gives Luke her valuable hairpins and shuts herself in a dark, dank prison cell with three other women.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber is taken to Newgate prison after her husband abandons her and she is unable to pay her debts, leaving her desperate and fearful for her future.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber forms an alliance with Moll Turner, a fellow inmate, who offers her advice on surviving in Newgate prison. Despite her initial skepticism, Amber decides to trust Moll and gives her valuable earrings in exchange for guidance on navigating life in the prison.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Mrs. Cleggat collects fees and belongings from the women, leaving Amber stripped of her valuables and forced to adapt to the harsh conditions of the prison cell in Newgate prison.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Cooper and his friends, including the Earl of Lauderdale and the Earl of Bristol, gather at Barbara's house for a lavish supper hosted by her. The room is filled with laughter, music, and extravagant food, and Barbara exudes confidence and power.

author: Kathleen Winsor

author: Kathleen Winsor

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber is confronted by the candleman in the Tap-Room, but she fights back and knocks the candle out of his hand. In a state of terror, she falls down the stairs, desperately trying to shield her pregnant belly.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber spends time with Black Jack, enjoying his company and the fresh air from the window. She becomes convinced that she can get him to give her the four hundred pounds she needs, and plans to leave him once she has the money.

author: Kathleen Winsor

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber receives a beautiful green gown from Black Jack Mallard and they go downstairs to meet Mother Red-Cap, who surprises Amber with her friendly demeanor and offers to find a midwife and a caretaker for the baby.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber discusses her concerns about the baby's future with Mother Red-Cap and considers leaving the child with a cottager's wife, while continuing to bond with Black Jack and rely on him for support during her pregnancy.

author: Kathleen Winsor

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber wakes up in the morning with a dull ache in her back and realizes she is in labor. Black Jack Mallard and Mother Red-Cap are called for help, and after a long and painful labor, Amber gives birth to a baby boy.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber recovers from childbirth and receives gifts for her baby. She befriends Penelope Hill, who gives her practical advice on preventing future pregnancies.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber christens her baby boy Bruce and holds a feast attended by Mother Red-Cap, Black Jack, and other acquaintances. She then hires Mrs. Chiverton to care for the baby and pays her to visit him regularly.

author: Kathleen Winsor

Minette and her brother Charles discuss her upcoming marriage to Philippe, with Charles expressing concern. Amber meets Mrs. Goodman, who becomes her close friend and introduces her to the fashionable world of London. Amber marries Luke Channell, but quickly realizes he is abusive and disrespectful. Her money disappears, causing fear and hopelessness. Luke violently attacks her, but Sally intervenes, causing tension between them. Amber is left alone and desperate to return to London. Amber, a woman who has lost all her money, finds herself in Newgate prison after her husband abandons her and she cannot pay her debts. She shares a prison cell with three other women, including Mrs. Cleggat, the jailor's wife, who demands payment for better accommodations. Desperate for money, Amber sells her wedding ring and pearl necklace. As her time in prison continues, Amber's funds dwindle, and she considers selling her gold earrings but realizes they are worthless. However, her situation takes a turn when she meets Black Jack Mallard, a notorious highwayman, who offers her protection and introduces her to a network of people who can help her. Mother Red-Cap offers to help Amber pay off her debt and leave the Friars, suggesting that she can provide a means for Amber to earn the money she needs. Amber becomes frustrated when Black Jack refuses to give her the money and contemplates asking Mother Red-Cap for a loan. Amber discusses her fears of hanging with Mother Red-Cap, but is dismissed and heads back to her room in Alsatia, feeling discouraged but determined to escape. She describes the dismal conditions of Alsatia and her longing to return to her previous life. Amber wakes up in the morning with a dull ache in her back and realizes she is in labor. Black Jack Mallard and Mother Red-Cap are called for help, and after a long and painful labor, Amber gives birth to a baby boy.

Amber's relationship with Bruce becomes strained when he reveals he cannot marry her. Frustrated and angry, Amber decides to distance herself from Bruce and focuses on her own future. Amber, a devastated woman, pleads with Bruce not to leave her, but he coldly forces himself away, leaving her stunned. The scene shifts to discussions between the Duke of York, King Charles II, and Queen Mother Henrietta Maria about James' marriage to Anne Hyde. Minette and her brother Charles discuss her upcoming marriage to Philippe, with Charles expressing concern. Amber meets Mrs. Goodman, who becomes her close friend and introduces her to the fashionable world of London. Amber marries Luke Channell, but quickly realizes he is abusive and disrespectful. Her money disappears, causing fear and hopelessness. Luke violently attacks her, but Sally intervenes, causing tension between them. Amber is left alone and desperate to return to London. Amber, a woman who has lost all her money, finds herself in Newgate prison after her husband abandons her and she cannot pay her debts. She shares a prison cell with three other women, including Mrs. Cleggat, the jailor's wife, who demands payment for better accommodations. Desperate for money, Amber sells her wedding ring and pearl necklace. As her time in prison continues, Amber's funds dwindle, and she considers selling her gold earrings but realizes they are worthless. However, her situation takes a turn when she meets Black Jack Mallard, a notorious highwayman, who offers her protection and introduces her to a network of people who can help her. Mother Red-Cap offers to help Amber pay off her debt and leave the Friars, suggesting that she can provide a means for Amber to earn the money she needs. Amber becomes frustrated when Black Jack refuses to give her the money and contemplates asking Mother Red-Cap for a loan. Amber discusses her fears of hanging with Mother Red-Cap, but is dismissed and heads back to her room in Alsatia, feeling discouraged but determined to escape. She describes the dismal conditions of Alsatia and her longing to return to her previous life. Amber wakes up in the morning with a dull ache in her back and realizes she is in labor. Black Jack Mallard and Mother Red-Cap are called for help, and after a long and painful labor, Amber gives birth to a baby boy. Amber christens her baby boy Bruce and holds a feast attended by Mother Red-Cap, Black Jack, and other acquaintances. She then hires Mrs. Chiverton to care for the baby and pays her to visit him regularly. Amber becomes dissatisfied with her life in the Sanctuary after catching the attention of King Charles II at a pageant, and she contemplates leaving. Amber, disguised as a lady, waits in a crowded room for a gentleman who is late, attracting the attention of other men. Nelly Gwynne, a young girl with a clear voice, performs and receives money from Tom Butterfield. Amber grows impatient waiting for a man and decides to leave with Tom, who offers to escort her home. However, as they enter a house, Black Jack Mallard attacks Tom, knocking him unconscious. Amber witnesses Black Jack Mallard attack Tom Butterfield and steal his belongings, causing her to feel guilty and concerned for Tom's well-being. Amber confronts Black Jack Mallard in a fit of anger and tries to leave the Friars, but he overpowers her and takes her back to their room. Amber realizes that Black Jack only sees her as a means of pleasure and despises him. Bess offers to help Amber escape the Friars, but Black Jack discovers their plan and physically abuses Bess. Amber suspects Bess of harming her pet bird. Every young coxcomb in London believes that a beautiful stranger has fallen in love with him and is willing to help her cuckold her husband, leading to successful schemes orchestrated by Black Jack Mallard and Mother Red-Cap. Amber discovers that Black Jack Mallard is being sought after by the authorities for his crimes as a highwayman, causing her to panic and fear for her safety.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Bess leaves the Sanctuary, causing tension between Amber and Black Jack. Amber becomes gloomy and despondent, feeling trapped in Whitefriars.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber goes to Knightsbridge with Black Jack and the others, hoping for a quick and successful robbery.

Bess and Amber have a confrontation, resulting in Bess being kicked out of the house by Mother Red-Cap.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber meets Theophilus Bidulph, an old acquaintance, at an inn and they have supper together while she anxiously waits for Black Jack Mallard to give her a signal to join them. Suddenly, there is a commotion outside and Amber realizes that thieves have arrived.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber tries to escape the inn as thieves arrive, but encounters a confrontation between Bess Columbine and Black Jack. In the chaos, she heads towards the front door, while Mr. Bidulph searches for her in the dark.
recaptext: A woman named Amber goes through a series of unfortunate events in her life. She starts off as a young woman who becomes involved with various men in London, but faces disappointment and abuse. She ends up in prison due to her debts, but meets a highwayman named Black Jack Mallard who offers her protection. However, their relationship becomes strained, and Amber feels trapped and desperate in her current situation.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber is chased by thieves and manages to escape by hiding in a food-hutch. She then runs away from the inn, through fields and parks, until she finally hires a coach to take her to Temple Bar.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber realizes she left her belongings at the inn and decides to return, but the angry coach driver follows her.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber runs through the streets, exhausted and terrified, until she is caught by a group of students who try to take advantage of her. Michael Godfrey, an old acquaintance, comes to her rescue and takes her to his rooms in Vine Court.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Michael comforts Amber and informs her that Black Jack Mallard, along with two others, has been hanged. Amber struggles to accept Black Jack's death and is haunted by the fear of her own mortality.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber becomes pious and stays in Michael Godfrey's apartment, pretending to be his nephew Tom, while he buys her boy's clothes and they enjoy their time together.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber's true identity is revealed when an old man, Mr. Gripenstraw, arrives with Michael, causing Amber to panic and realize that her disguise as Tom has been discovered.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Michael settle into their new lodgings at the Hoop and Grapes inn, fully embracing the extravagant and pleasure-seeking lifestyle of their social circle, which includes attending theaters, gambling, and engaging in reckless behavior.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber flirts with Captain Morgan and plans to meet him at the Fox-Urider-the-Hill. Michael's relationship with his father becomes strained, and Amber must convince Sir Michael to let Michael stay in London and continue supporting her.

Amber attends the play at the King's Theatre, feeling nervous and overwhelmed by the grandeur of the audience and the presence of the King. She musters the courage to go on stage and receives positive attention from the audience. Amber becomes a popular actress, performing in important roles and receiving attention from gallants after the performances. Amber receives a note from Captain Rex Morgan expressing his interest in her, but she tears it up and keeps it a secret from Beck. Later, Amber encounters Michael's father, Sir Michael Godfrey, who disapproves of her and announces that Michael will be returning to the country with him. Amber meets Captain Rex Morgan at a private-room and they enjoy a good meal together, engaging in comfortable conversation and admiring each other.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber negotiates with Captain Rex Morgan for her terms as his mistress, securing a luxurious apartment, a coach, and a maid, and they consummate their relationship.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber's success as an actress and relationship with Captain Rex Morgan bring her more attention and opportunities in the theater world, but also conflicts and complications as her ambitions grow.
recaptext: A woman named Amber goes through a series of unfortunate events in her life. She starts off as a young woman who becomes involved with various men in London, but faces disappointment and abuse. She ends up in prison due to her debts, but meets a highwayman named Black Jack Mallard who offers her protection. However, their relationship becomes strained, and Amber feels trapped and desperate in her current situation. Amber meets Theophilus Bidulph, an old acquaintance, at an inn and they have supper together while she anxiously waits for Black Jack Mallard to give her a signal to join them. Suddenly, there is a commotion outside and Amber realizes that thieves have arrived. Amber is chased by thieves and manages to escape by hiding in a food-hutch. She then runs away from the inn, through fields and parks, until she finally hires a coach to take her to Temple Bar. Amber runs through the streets, exhausted and terrified, until she is caught by a group of students who try to take advantage of her. Michael Godfrey, an old acquaintance, comes to her rescue and takes her to his rooms in Vine Court. Amber becomes pious and stays in Michael Godfrey's apartment, pretending to be his nephew Tom, while he buys her boy's clothes and they enjoy their time together. Mr. Gripenstraw confronts Michael Godfrey about Amber's presence in his rooms, leading to Michael's expulsion from the premises. Amber discovers she is pregnant and seeks out a midwife to induce an abortion, keeping it a secret from Michael. Amber and Captain Rex Morgan engage in a passionate encounter, but Amber abruptly leaves, feeling conflicted about their relationship.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber prepares for her role as Cleopatra in the play and engages in a tense encounter with Beck, while the audience reacts with mixed emotions to her provocative performance.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Beck seeks revenge on Amber for her newfound success and plots to sabotage her performance as Cleopatra, leading to a dramatic confrontation on stage.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Beck engage in a violent physical fight backstage at the theater, resulting in torn costumes and injuries, while the audience outside clamors to be let in.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Beck reconcile and become friends, laughing off their previous animosity. They continue to perform together in the theater, building a camaraderie among the female actors.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: The Earl of Sandwich arrives in Portugal to meet the Infanta, who is surrounded by her attendants and priests, all of whom are nervous and ill-at-ease.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Charles and Catherine get married in a secret Catholic ceremony in her bedchamber, followed by a ceremony according to the rites of the Church of England.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Catherine, the new Queen of England, is advised by an old lady named Penalva to reform the manners and morals of the courtiers and ladies at the English court, and to return to her native costume.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Catherine appears at a banquet in her native costume, causing speculation among the courtiers. She asserts herself as a leader in her own court and tries to gain the respect of the English courtiers.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Catherine's decision to remove Lady Castlemaine from the list of attendants causes tension between her and King Charles. Catherine anxiously tries to broach the subject with him, hoping for his understanding and support.

author: Kathleen Winsor

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Charles is displeased with the Dowager Queen for paying most of Catherine's dowry in sugar and spices instead of gold, causing tension between them. Charles invites Barbara Palmer, also known as Lady Castlemaine, to Hampton Court, where Catherine is waiting anxiously for him. When Charles arrives with Lady Castlemaine, Catherine is shocked and faints, leading to a confrontation between Charles and Catherine's supporters.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Catherine's fainting spell causes a rift between her and Charles, as she feels betrayed by his actions. She becomes determined to assert her power and regain control over her own life.

author: Kathleen Winsor

When Charles arrives with Lady Castlemaine, Catherine is shocked and faints, leading to a confrontation between Charles and Catherine's supporters. Amber encounters the Earl of Almsbury at a pageant and they engage in a friendly conversation, reminiscing about their past and discussing Amber's current success as an actress. Amber and the Earl of Almsbury have a conversation about their relationship, with Amber expressing her concerns about her jealous lover, Rex, and her hesitation to marry him.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber hires Nan Britton as her serving-woman and they quickly become good friends, sharing confidences and stories about their past experiences.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Nan grow closer, with Nan encouraging Amber to marry Captain Morgan. However, Amber becomes less interested in him and hints at a potential romantic connection with King Charles, but warns Nan not to tell Captain Morgan.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber revels in her elevated status and popularity as an actress, but her arrogance and inflated ego start to alienate those around her, leading to conflicts and challenges that threaten her success.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber receives a royal summons and excitedly plans what to wear. She heads to Mr. Progers' lodgings for the appointment.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber is robbed by a man who demands the bag of coins given to her by the King, and she realizes that it was Barbara Palmer who orchestrated the theft.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber vows revenge on Barbara Palmer for the robbery, while Captain Morgan returns and expresses his love for her, resulting in a joyful reunion.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber receives a beautiful necklace from Rex and Nan receives a pair of earrings, making them both happy. Amber becomes pregnant again and decides to have an abortion, causing tension between her and Rex.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber plans to celebrate her son's birthday and give him gifts, while Rex leaves for a trip. Amber contemplates marrying Rex but still feels uncertain about her future happiness.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber is interrupted during her bath by the arrival of Lord Almsbury and Bruce Carlton, causing her to feel shocked and paralyzed.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber goes out with Bruce Carlton, leaving Lord Almsbury behind. They spend the day together, rekindling their intense attraction and forgetting about everything else in their lives.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Lord Carlton reconnect and reminisce about their past, discussing their experiences and adventures. They contemplate a future together, sharing their dreams and aspirations.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Lord Carlton visit Mrs. Chiverton's cottage to see their baby, exchange gifts, and share a meal before leaving. On their way back, their passion for each other intensifies, leading them to stop at an inn in Hoxton.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber returns home and reassures Rex about her absence, while confiding in Nan about her love for Lord Carlton and asking for her help in keeping the affair a secret from Rex.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber grows suspicious of Bruce's relationship with Miss Leah and plans to confront Tansy to find out the truth. However, before she can do so, Rex Morgan enters the scene and interrupts their conversation.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber welcomes Rex Morgan and her other guests into her home, but becomes increasingly nervous and tries to convince Rex of her interest in him. She manages to exchange a secret message with Lord Carlton before he leaves, and later comes up with a plan to go away with Rex into the country.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Rex go away together into the country, enjoying uninterrupted time together. However, their idyllic getaway is interrupted when they receive news that tests their relationship.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Catherine, the Queen of England, is gravely ill and expresses her sorrow to Charles, who reassures her and promises that she will have a son in the future. Meanwhile, the court speculates about Charles' next marriage, with Frances Stewart being the favored candidate, and Lady Castlemaine feigns concern for Catherine's well-being.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Charles remains devoted to Catherine as she deteriorates, seeking solace in Frances Stewart. Lady Castlemaine, fearing her own ruin, desperately tries to save Catherine and prevent Frances from becoming the next Queen.
recaptext: A woman named Amber goes through a series of unfortunate events in her life. She starts off as a young woman who becomes involved with various men in London, but faces disappointment and abuse. She ends up in prison due to her debts, but meets a highwayman named Black Jack Mallard who offers her protection. However, their relationship becomes strained, and Amber feels trapped and desperate in her current situation. Amber, a young woman, meets Theophilus Bidulph at an inn and they have supper together. Thieves arrive and Amber escapes by hiding in a food-hutch, then runs away and hires a coach to take her to Temple Bar. She is caught by students, but Michael Godfrey rescues her and takes her to his apartment. Amber pretends to be his nephew and they spend time together. Amber becomes pregnant and seeks an abortion. She auditions at the King's Theatre and impresses the directors, landing a role. She becomes a popular actress and receives attention from gallants. Amber meets Captain Rex Morgan and they have a passionate encounter. They negotiate terms and become involved. Amber prepares for her role as Cleopatra and gets into a fight with Beck backstage. The Earl of Sandwich arrives in Portugal to meet the nervous and ill-at-ease Infanta, surrounded by attendants and priests. Catherine, the new Queen of England, is advised by old lady Penalva to reform the manners and morals of the courtiers and ladies, and to return to her native costume. Catherine refuses to accept Lady Castlemaine as a lady of the bedchamber, causing tension with Charles. Charles invites Lady Castlemaine to Hampton Court, where Catherine faints, leading to a confrontation. Amber, an actress, encounters the Earl of Almsbury and they reminisce about their past. Amber hires Nan Britton as her serving-woman and they become friends. Amber becomes increasingly disgraced and unhappy, robbed by Barbara Palmer, and interrupted during her bath by Lord Almsbury and Bruce Carlton. Amber reunites with Lord Carlton after two and a half years apart, expressing their love and discussing their experiences. They visit Mrs. Chiverton's cottage to see their baby, exchange gifts, and share a meal. On their way back, their passion intensifies, leading them to an inn in Hoxton. Amber prepares for Lord Carlton's visit, but becomes jealous when she sees him with Lady Almsbury. She meets Tansy, has supper with Lady Almsbury, and welcomes Rex Morgan and other guests. Amber exchanges a secret message with Lord Carlton and plans to go away with Rex. She convinces Bruce to travel with her, but they say their goodbyes. Amber returns to find Rex waiting and he confronts her about her infidelity. Rex threatens a duel with Lord Carlton, causing Amber to worry. Despite her desperate attempts to stop the duel, it begins and Rex fights with reckless fury. Bruce eventually wounds Rex, causing Amber to scream in terror. Meanwhile, Barbara seeks Dr. Heydon's help to understand the King's behavior after the Queen gives birth.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara fears that the Queen is dying and her gatherings with the King become somber. The King receives news of the Queen's deteriorating condition and rushes to her bedside.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: The King confronts the priests and doctors, demanding they leave, and promises a better future. He pleads with the Queen to live for him and their son, but she sadly accepts her impending death.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber mourns the death of Rex Morgan and reflects on how much he meant to her, feeling lost and apprehensive about the future.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber's popularity rises as she returns to the theatre, but she struggles with the shallow and cruel nature of the tiring-room gallants. She misses the security and love she had with Rex, and begins to question her choices and the men she surrounds herself with.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber enjoys her popularity as an actress but becomes increasingly frustrated with the men who only want to keep her temporarily, leading her to consider a different plan for finding a wealthy husband.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber continues to navigate London's high society, attending social events and encountering various suitors. She eventually meets a man who offers her the indecent proposal she desires, leading her to make a life-changing decision.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: The Duke of Buckingham notices Amber and engages in conversation with her, showing a particular interest in her. They begin a romantic relationship.

author: Kathleen Winsor

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: The Duke of Buckingham propositions Amber, offering her money for sex, which she reluctantly accepts, feeling disgusted and vowing to seek revenge against him. After this encounter, Amber becomes popular among the finest beaus in town, attending various social events and engaging in intimate relationships with them.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber enjoys her popularity among the beaus, attending social events and engaging in intimate relationships with them. She plans to seek revenge against the Duke of Buckingham and her other enemies when she gains enough power.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber's popularity as an actress leads her to compromise her principles and engage in relationships with wealthy men, receiving gifts and attention in return, but as her popularity wanes and she discovers she is pregnant again, she becomes disillusioned and decides to leave London for Tunbridge Wells.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber arrives in Tunbridge Wells feeling miserable and unwell, and as they continue their journey, they encounter a gentleman who has been robbed by highwaymen, and he joins them in their coach.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Samuel Dangerfield travel together to Tunbridge Wells, where they part ways at the inn. Amber rents a cottage and begins to contemplate her future.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber learns that Samuel Dangerfield is one of the richest men in England and decides to pursue him as a potential husband. She plans to go to the wells and drink the waters in hopes of catching his attention.

Amber meets Captain Rex Morgan and they have a passionate encounter. They negotiate terms and become involved. Amber prepares for her role as Cleopatra and gets into a fight with Beck backstage. The Earl of Sandwich arrives in Portugal to meet the nervous and ill-at-ease Infanta, surrounded by attendants and priests. Catherine, the new Queen of England, is advised by old lady Penalva to reform the manners and morals of the courtiers and ladies, and to return to her native costume. Catherine refuses to accept Lady Castlemaine as a lady of the bedchamber, causing tension with Charles. Charles invites Lady Castlemaine to Hampton Court, where Catherine faints, leading to a confrontation. Amber, an actress, encounters the Earl of Almsbury and they reminisce about their past. Amber hires Nan Britton as her serving-woman and they become friends. Amber becomes increasingly disgraced and unhappy, robbed by Barbara Palmer, and interrupted during her bath by Lord Almsbury and Bruce Carlton. Amber reunites with Lord Carlton after two and a half years apart, expressing their love and discussing their experiences. They visit Mrs. Chiverton's cottage to see their baby, exchange gifts, and share a meal. On their way back, their passion intensifies, leading them to an inn in Hoxton. Amber prepares for Lord Carlton's visit, but becomes jealous when she sees him with Lady Almsbury. She meets Tansy, has supper with Lady Almsbury, and welcomes Rex Morgan and other guests. Amber exchanges a secret message with Lord Carlton and plans to go away with Rex. She convinces Bruce to travel with her, but they say their goodbyes. Amber returns to find Rex waiting and he confronts her about her infidelity. Rex threatens a duel with Lord Carlton, causing Amber to worry. Despite her desperate attempts to stop the duel, it begins and Rex fights with reckless fury. Bruce eventually wounds Rex, causing Amber to scream in terror. Meanwhile, Barbara seeks Dr. Heydon's help to understand the King's behavior after the Queen gives birth. Catherine, the Queen of England, is gravely ill and expresses her sorrow to Charles, who reassures her and promises that she will have a son in the future. Meanwhile, the court speculates about Charles' next marriage, with Frances Stewart being the favored candidate, and Lady Castlemaine feigns concern for Catherine's well-being. Barbara fears that the Queen is dying and her gatherings with the King become somber. The King receives news of the Queen's deteriorating condition and rushes to her bedside. Amber mourns the death of Rex Morgan and reflects on how much he meant to her, feeling lost and apprehensive about the future. Amber enjoys her popularity as an actress but becomes increasingly frustrated with the men who only want to keep her temporarily, leading her to consider a different plan for finding a wealthy husband. Amber is accompanied by three young fops who gossip and make snide remarks about people passing by, while she hopes to catch the attention of a great man. Amber is invited by the Duke of Buckingham to be his guest for supper at Long's, a fashionable ordinary in the Haymarket, and she worries about how to please him and make a good impression. The Duke of Buckingham propositions Amber, offering her money for sex, which she reluctantly accepts, feeling disgusted and vowing to seek revenge against him. After this encounter, Amber becomes popular among the finest beaus in town, attending various social events and engaging in intimate relationships with them. Amber's popularity as an actress leads her to compromise her principles and engage in relationships with wealthy men, receiving gifts and attention in return, but as her popularity wanes and she discovers she is pregnant again, she becomes disillusioned and decides to leave London for Tunbridge Wells.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber encounters two young men, Frank Kifflin and Will Wigglesworth, in Tunbridge Wells who seem to recognize her as an actress but she denies it and tries to avoid their suspicions.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber agrees to go to the gaming-house with Frank and Will, hoping to find a way to get rid of them and protect her secret identity.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber agrees to join Frank Kifflin and Will Wigglesworth in a game of raffle, pretending to have no money but suspecting their involvement in passing counterfeit coins.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber invites Mr. Dangerfield to dinner and subtly reveals to him that Frank Kifflin and Will Wigglesworth approached her to change money, hinting at their involvement in counterfeiting.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Samuel Dangerfield confront Frank Kifflin and Will Wigglesworth about the false coin and discuss the possibility of involving the constable. However, the young men quickly realize they have been found out and make a hasty escape, running away from Tunbridge Wells.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber takes care of Mr. Dangerfield while he is ill, refusing to leave his side and providing him with constant attention and care. Meanwhile, Barbara and James Hamilton wake up to find their room on fire and struggle to put out the flames.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber cares for Mr. Dangerfield, relishing in her role as his nursemaid. Barbara and James Hamilton put out the fire in their room with the assistance of servants, but the incident leaves them unsettled.
recaptext: Amber, a young woman in London, faces a series of unfortunate events, including disappointment and abuse from various men. She ends up in prison due to her debts but finds protection with a highwayman named Black Jack Mallard. However, their relationship becomes strained, and Amber feels trapped. She meets Theophilus Bidulph and escapes thieves, eventually becoming a popular actress. Along the way, she encounters various romantic interests and faces challenges in her personal and professional life. Despite her attempts to find happiness and stability, Amber's journey is marked by disillusionment and a longing for something more.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara wakes up to find her room on fire and tries to save a cabinet with important letters, but the Duke of Buckingham takes one of the letters and refuses to give it back.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara confronts the Duke of Buckingham and demands the return of the letter, threatening to publish them. The Duke warns her that if she tries to publish the letters, she won't be able to find them because they could be stolen by someone in the Palace.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara attends the opening performance of John Dryden's new play, "The Maiden Queen," with the Court party. The King catches a fan that falls on his head and presents it back to the woman, receiving applause.
recaptext: Amber, a young woman in London, faces a series of unfortunate events, including disappointment and abuse from various men. She ends up in prison due to her debts but finds protection with a highwayman named Black Jack Mallard. However, their relationship becomes strained, and Amber feels trapped. She meets Theophilus Bidulph and escapes thieves, eventually becoming a popular actress. Along the way, she encounters various romantic interests and faces challenges in her personal and professional life. Despite her attempts to find happiness and stability, Amber's journey is marked by disillusionment and a longing for something more. Amber takes care of Mr. Dangerfield while he is ill, refusing to leave his side and providing him with constant attention and care. Meanwhile, Barbara and James Hamilton wake up to find their room on fire and struggle to put out the flames. Barbara wakes up to find her room on fire and tries to save a cabinet with important letters, but the Duke of Buckingham takes one of the letters and refuses to give it back.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: The passage depicts a scene at the theater where Charles, Catherine, and York are seated with other members of the royal party. Barbara engages in gossip with Mrs. Boynton and Frances Stewart, while Monmouth shows interest in Barbara. Mrs. Jennings tears up a note from York and the brothers make a wager.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara devises a plan to capture Charles' attention during the play and successfully executes it, drawing his gaze towards her.

Barbara and the Duke of Buckingham discuss the importance of her letters and he suggests she burn them to protect herself. Barbara agrees and burns the letters, feeling relieved to have them gone.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara confronts Charles and York at the theater, feeling humiliated and enraged by their dismissive behavior towards her.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara confronts Buckingham about her humiliation and demands an explanation. However, Buckingham reveals that he knows about her burning the king's letters, leaving Barbara horrified and powerless.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber arrives at Samuel Dangerfield's grand house and feels nervous about meeting his family, particularly his daughter Lettice, who appears cold and unwelcoming towards her.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Lettice is shocked and initially disapproving of Amber as her father's new wife, but Samuel tries to calm her down and asks her to accept the situation and be happy for him. Amber waits nervously for Lettice's response.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Lettice's dislike for Amber softens as she gets to know her better and sees her genuine intentions. Amber's efforts to win over Samuel's family pay off, and they start to warm up to her, realizing that she is not as different as they initially thought.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber returns to the theater and is greeted by her friends and admirers, who are curious about her recent absence and marriage to a rich merchant. She feels at ease for the first time in months, but her comfort is disrupted when she sees Henry Dangerfield and quickly leaves the room.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber waits anxiously for Samuel Dangerfield's return, feeling relieved when he finally arrives. They share an intimate moment, but Amber worries about Henry Dangerfield's potential suspicion. She decides to join the family for supper, hoping to act normally and dispel any doubts.

Lettice confronts Jemima about their step-mother's past as an actress, causing tension and disagreement between them. Jemima confides in Amber about her desire to have a lover, expressing her dislike for common men and her admiration for gentlemen. Amber discusses Jemima's infatuation with Lord Carlton and her upcoming marriage to Joseph Cuttle with Samuel Dangerfield, who agrees to let Amber talk to Jemima about it. Amber rushes back to Samuel Dangerfield's office and unexpectedly encounters Bruce, who is now known as Lord Carlton. They exchange formal greetings, and Amber hastily excuses herself, feeling overwhelmed by their encounter.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Lord Carlton and Amber attend a lavish dinner party at the Dangerfield residence, where they interact politely despite having been intimate just hours before. Amber becomes jealous when Jemima flirts with Lord Carlton, but she intervenes and introduces Joseph to them.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber confronts Lord Carlton about his plans to leave, expressing her frustration at his sudden departure. Lord Carlton reassures her and asks her to smile, hinting at a deeper connection between them.

author: Kathleen Winsor

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Charles listens to the petitions of his courtiers and encounters sick individuals who ask him to heal them, while Buckingham catches up with him and tries to introduce someone to him. Charles enters the chapel, where he sits alone in the Royal Closet and enjoys the music, while the young chaplain begins his sermon and unintentionally causes laughter in the congregation.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Charles continues to attend the sermon, trying to conceal his amusement, while Frances Stewart, who is sitting close to him, gasps with laughter. After the sermon, Charles will likely engage in conversation with Frances and perhaps make plans to meet her later.

author: Kathleen Winsor

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber's fears grow as the plague spreads, and she becomes increasingly concerned for her daughter's safety. She takes drastic measures to protect them both, navigating the challenges of living in a city gripped by fear and death.

author: Kathleen Winsor

Amber, now the Countess of Radclyffe, attends a royal event at Whitehall Palace, feeling nervous and excited as she walks down the corridor towards the throne, surrounded by whispers and judgment from the other attendees. Amber attends a royal event at Whitehall Palace and is asked to dance by Lord Buckhurst, much to her delight. She enjoys herself and attracts attention, causing her husband, the Earl of Radclyffe, to become displeased. Amber enjoys a night of triumph at a royal event, dancing and flirting with the young and handsome men of the Court, but her husband, the Earl of Radclyffe, abruptly ends the evening and takes her home, leaving her feeling hurt and disappointed. Amber confronts her husband, the Earl of Radclyffe, about her desire to leave the house and expresses her frustration with her treatment. Despite her anger, Amber realizes that she is trapped and fears for her safety. Amber, delighted to be out again, observes and comments on the bustling streets of London during the plague, encounters three familiar figures, and engages in a playful conversation with them. Amber excitedly tells Radclyffe about seeing the King in the rain and receiving an invitation to a dance at the palace, while Radclyffe smiles and listens, feeling unimportant and forgotten.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: The Countess of Radclyffe, Amber, is infatuated with Charles and agrees to meet him secretly, disregarding her husband's presence.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber confronts Radclyffe about her feelings for Charles and demands to be untied, but Radclyffe revels in his control over her and refuses to release her.
recaptext: Amber, a young woman in London, faces a series of unfortunate events, including disappointment and abuse from various men. She ends up in prison due to her debts but finds protection with a highwayman named Black Jack Mallard. However, their relationship becomes strained, and Amber feels trapped. She meets Theophilus Bidulph and escapes thieves, eventually becoming a popular actress. Along the way, she encounters various romantic interests and faces challenges in her personal and professional life. Despite her attempts to find happiness and stability, Amber's journey is marked by disillusionment and a longing for something more. As the plague spreads in London, Amber faces worsening conditions and tries to protect her sick husband Bruce from the presence of death. Amber and Bruce, a married couple, are living in a time of plague. Amber falls ill with the disease and Bruce desperately tries to save her, resorting to cutting open a carbuncle on her groin. Despite his efforts, Amber falls into a coma. Sykes, their nurse, takes charge and works tirelessly to keep Amber alive. Eventually, both Amber and Bruce recover from the plague and plan to escape the city on a yacht. They visit their son and settle in a country house, but Amber becomes doubtful about Bruce's intentions as he plans to return to London and sail to America. Amber, a discontented wife, becomes determined to follow her husband Bruce to London after he leaves without her. She attends a dinner with the uninteresting Earl of Radclyffe and flirts with Lord Rawstorne as a diversion. Despite warnings, she chooses a cursed blackamoor statue and receives a letter from Radclyffe. Eager for status, she accepts Radclyffe's proposal and becomes the Countess of Radclyffe, but soon feels bored and resentful. She signs away her money in anger and pleads for the safety of a monkey, realizing her vulnerability. At a royal event, she enjoys dancing and attention, causing Radclyffe's displeasure. Feeling trapped, she confronts her husband and fears for her safety. Delighted to be out during the plague, she encounters familiar figures and cheats in a game of dice to impress the King.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and her husband, Radclyffe, have a heated argument where he threatens to take her money and she vows to kill him. The landlady interrupts their argument and brings them food, trying to be friendly.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Radclyffe arrive at Lime Park, a grand estate. Radclyffe's daughter-in-law, Jennifer, greets them and informs them that Radclyffe's son is not home.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber arrives at Lime Park with her husband Radclyffe and meets his son's wife, Jennifer. Radclyffe insists that Jennifer rest due to her illness, but Amber is eager to explore the house and gardens.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Jennifer become close friends, enjoying each other's company and exploring Lime Park together. Amber continues to talk about London, trying to persuade Jennifer to visit, but Jennifer remains hesitant, feeling that she would be out of place in the bustling city.

text: Amber, relieved that she won't be caught, puts on mourning for her supposedly deceased husband Radclyffe, but she is not truly sorry for his death and feels haunted by his presence.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Lady Denham falls ill and accuses Lord York of poisoning her, causing speculation among the courtiers. Amber, eager to secure her position at court, befriends Frances Stewart and becomes inseparable from her, gaining access to the inner circle.

author: Kathleen Winsor

They visit their son and settle in a country house, but Amber becomes doubtful about Bruce's intentions as he plans to return to London and sail to America. Amber, a discontented wife, becomes determined to follow her husband Bruce to London after he leaves without her. She attends a dinner with the uninteresting Earl of Radclyffe and flirts with Lord Rawstorne as a diversion. Despite warnings, she chooses a cursed blackamoor statue and receives a letter from Radclyffe. Eager for status, she accepts Radclyffe's proposal and becomes the Countess of Radclyffe, but soon feels bored and resentful. She signs away her money in anger and pleads for the safety of a monkey, realizing her vulnerability. At a royal event, she enjoys dancing and attention, causing Radclyffe's displeasure. Feeling trapped, she confronts her husband and fears for her safety. Delighted to be out during the plague, she encounters familiar figures and cheats in a game of dice to impress the King. Amber, the Countess of Radclyffe, is infatuated with Charles and agrees to meet him secretly, despite her husband's presence. She also vows to kill her husband, Radclyffe. Amber arrives at Lime Park and engages in flirtatious conversations with her daughter-in-law, Jenny, and seduces her stepson, Philip. She becomes increasingly bored and resentful of her life with Radclyffe in the country. Amber confronts Radclyffe about his intention to leave for London alone, and they have a heated argument. Amber and her companions rush towards London during a devastating fire. She confronts Radclyffe in his laboratory, attacks him, and escapes as the house catches fire. Amber puts on mourning for Radclyffe but feels haunted by his presence.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber tries to convince Frances to become the King's mistress, but Frances refuses due to her aversion to sleeping with men. Their friendship ends, and Amber feels contemptuous towards Frances.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber invites Chancellor Clarendon to a supper at Almsbury House, hoping to parade him as her trophy, but he declines the invitation, leaving her humiliated.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Barbara discuss Frances Stewart, who has become a rival to both of them, and Amber reveals that she is pregnant with the King's child.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber agrees to marry again at the King's request, but only if he finds her a husband she can ignore. The King introduces her to a young man across the room who appears nervous and ill at ease.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber confronts Charles about his suggestion and expresses her desire to have more control over her own finances and life. She contemplates taking on a more dominant role in her relationships.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara reveals her true intentions to Charles, causing him to become even more skeptical and cynical. He confronts Barbara about her manipulations and their relationship becomes strained. Frances Stewart plots her own strategy to gain power and influence at court.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Heydon and Villiers discuss a prophecy that predicts King Charles will die by poison, secretly administered. Barbara Palmer, also known as Lady Castlemaine, arrives at Heydon's place and demands his help in determining the father of her unborn child.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara Palmer, desperate to secure her position at court, uses the information Heydon provides to manipulate and control those involved in her quest for power. She schemes and plots to ensure that her child's paternity is advantageous to her own ambitions.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara and Heydon discuss the names of the gentlemen who may have been involved in Barbara's misfortune, but their conversation is interrupted when they discover that the Duke of Buckingham has been eavesdropping on them.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara confronts the Duke of Buckingham for spying on her and they engage in a physical altercation. Buckingham tries to persuade Barbara to let him accompany her to her lodgings, claiming it is dangerous to travel alone in the ruins of the city.

Frances returns all the gifts she received from King Charles, and then visits Queen Catherine to apologize and seek forgiveness for her behavior. Heydon and Villiers discuss a prophecy that predicts King Charles will die by poison, secretly administered. Barbara Palmer, also known as Lady Castlemaine, arrives at Heydon's place and demands his help in determining the father of her unborn child.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Buckingham and Barbara leave in a coach, discussing the horoscope that Buckingham is having cast and the potential danger it poses if revealed.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Buckingham and Barbara arrive at their destination and meet with the astrologer to discuss the horoscope, leading to a revelation that could have significant consequences for their lives and relationships.
recaptext: Amber, a young woman in London, faces a series of unfortunate events, including disappointment and abuse from various men. She ends up in prison due to her debts but finds protection with a highwayman named Black Jack Mallard. However, their relationship becomes strained, and Amber feels trapped. She meets Theophilus Bidulph and escapes thieves, eventually becoming a popular actress. Along the way, she encounters various romantic interests and faces challenges in her personal and professional life. Despite her attempts to find happiness and stability, Amber's journey is marked by disillusionment and a longing for something more. As the plague spreads in London, Amber faces worsening conditions and tries to protect her sick husband Bruce from the presence of death. Amber and Bruce, a married couple, are living in a time of plague. Amber falls ill with the disease and Bruce desperately tries to save her, resorting to cutting open a carbuncle on her groin. Despite his efforts, Amber falls into a coma. Sykes, their nurse, takes charge and works tirelessly to keep Amber alive. Eventually, both Amber and Bruce recover from the plague and plan to escape the city on a yacht. They visit their son and settle in a country house, but Amber becomes doubtful about Bruce's intentions as he plans to return to London and sail to America. Amber, a discontented wife, becomes determined to follow her husband Bruce to London after he leaves without her. She attends a dinner with the uninteresting Earl of Radclyffe and flirts with Lord Rawstorne as a diversion. Despite warnings, she chooses a cursed blackamoor statue and receives a letter from Radclyffe. Eager for status, she accepts Radclyffe's proposal and becomes the Countess of Radclyffe, but soon feels bored and resentful. She signs away her money in anger and pleads for the safety of a monkey, realizing her vulnerability. At a royal event, she enjoys dancing and attention, causing Radclyffe's displeasure. Feeling trapped, she confronts her husband and fears for her safety. Delighted to be out during the plague, she encounters familiar figures and cheats in a game of dice to impress the King. Amber, the Countess of Radclyffe, is infatuated with Charles and agrees to meet him secretly, despite her husband's presence. She also vows to kill her husband, Radclyffe. Amber arrives at Lime Park and engages in flirtatious conversations with her daughter-in-law, Jenny, and seduces her stepson, Philip. She becomes increasingly bored and resentful of her life with Radclyffe in the country. Amber confronts Radclyffe about his intention to leave for London alone, and they have a heated argument. Amber and her companions rush towards London during a devastating fire. She confronts Radclyffe in his laboratory, attacks him, and escapes as the house catches fire. Amber puts on mourning for Radclyffe but feels haunted by his presence. Lady Denham falls ill and accuses Lord York of poisoning her, causing speculation among the courtiers. Amber, eager to secure her position at court, befriends Frances Stewart and becomes inseparable from her, gaining access to the inner circle. Amber tries to convince Frances to become the King's mistress, but Frances refuses due to her aversion to sleeping with men. Their friendship ends, and Amber feels contemptuous towards Frances. Amber and Barbara discuss Frances Stewart, who has become a rival to both of them, and Amber reveals that she is pregnant with the King's child. Amber is shocked when Charles suggests that she marry a baron, as she believes her status as a countess should warrant a higher-ranking husband. Catherine enters the room and flirts with Charles, while Frances Stewart realizes that she will never be Queen of England as long as Catherine is alive. Barbara interrupts Charles in his private closet and claims to have important news for him. Frances Stewart reveals to King Charles that she has been having an affair with Richmond, causing Charles to confront her and find them together in bed. Frances returns all the gifts she received from King Charles, and then visits Queen Catherine to apologize and seek forgiveness for her behavior. Heydon and Villiers discuss a prophecy that predicts King Charles will die by poison, secretly administered. Barbara Palmer, also known as Lady Castlemaine, arrives at Heydon's place and demands his help in determining the father of her unborn child. Barbara and Heydon discuss the names of the gentlemen who may have been involved in Barbara's misfortune, but their conversation is interrupted when they discover that the Duke of Buckingham has been eavesdropping on them.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara confronts King Charles about the money she needs, and reveals that she knows about his attempt to find out if York will become king. Charles discusses the situation with Baron Arlington and plans to gather evidence against Buckingham.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Buckingham continues to elude capture, disguising himself and even entering the Palace undetected. Eventually, he will be arrested and confront King Charles.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara pleads with George to clear her name, but he insists that she convince the King of his innocence. He then leaves her apartment and is never seen at Lady Castlemaine's door again. Amber, now married to Gerald Stanhope, suggests they live separately, causing scandal among the fashionable crowd.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber refuses to let Gerald's mother stay with them and questions why she would want to come to London. Gerald suggests that his mother wants to see her old acquaintances and questions why they live apart. Amber tells him to write to his mother and explain that they are married and can manage their own affairs. Gerald starts smoking a pipe, which angers Amber.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber scowls at her reflection, expressing her dissatisfaction with her husband and the dullness of married life, while her hairdresser, Monsieur Durand, flatters her and she rewards him with three guineas. She then leaves for a ball, with her gown designed by a prestigious dressmaker, to make a statement and assert her social status.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber attends a ball, seeking attention and admiration from the other guests. She engages in flirtatious conversations, dances, and revels in the knowledge that she has secured the services of Monsieur Durand, who was previously associated with Lady Castlemaine. However, her dissatisfaction with her marriage and her desire for excitement and power continue to grow.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Lady Stanhope, Gerald's mother, receives a letter from Lady Clifford informing her that Gerald has married the former Countess of Radclyffe and they are not living together yet, causing her to become concerned about her son's welfare.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Lady Stanhope rushes to London to find out why Gerald and his wife are not living together and to ensure her son's well-being.
recaptext: Amber, a young woman in London, faces a series of unfortunate events and ends up in prison. She finds protection with a highwayman named Black Jack Mallard but their relationship becomes strained. She meets Theophilus Bidulph and becomes a popular actress, encountering various romantic interests along the way. As the plague spreads, Amber faces worsening conditions and tries to protect her sick husband Bruce. Eventually, they recover from the plague and plan to escape the city, but Amber becomes doubtful about Bruce's intentions. She attends a dinner, accepts a proposal from the Earl of Radclyffe, and becomes the Countess of Radclyffe. However, she soon feels bored and resentful, and her infatuation with Charles leads to a plan to kill Radclyffe. Amber engages in flirtations, confronts Radclyffe, and escapes during a fire. She puts on mourning but feels haunted by Radclyffe's presence. Amber befriends Frances Stewart and reveals she is pregnant with the King's child. Charles suggests she marry a baron, causing tension. Frances reveals her affair, Barbara seeks help in determining the father of her child, and Charles plans to gather evidence against Buckingham. Amber, now married to Gerald Stanhope, attends a ball to assert her social status.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Lady Stanhope meets her new daughter-in-law, Amber, and expresses her disapproval of Amber and Gerald living apart.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Lady Stanhope pressures Amber and Gerald to live together, causing tension. Amber devises a plan to assert her independence and prove herself to Lady Stanhope.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber reluctantly accepts Lady Stanhope's offer to stay in London, while Gerald reveals his disinterest in spending time with his wife. After returning from Whitehall, Amber is surprised by the arrival of Bruce, her husband, and they share a passionate reunion.

Amber, now married to Gerald Stanhope, attends a ball to assert her social status. Lady Stanhope, Gerald's mother, receives a letter from Lady Clifford informing her that Gerald has married the former Countess of Radclyffe and they are not living together yet, causing her to become concerned about her son's welfare. Lady Stanhope meets her new daughter-in-law, Amber, and expresses her disapproval of Amber and Gerald living apart. Lady Stanhope offers Amber a place to stay in London, and Amber reluctantly accepts. Gerald, Amber's husband, reveals that he is engaged to dine with some gentlemen instead of spending time with her.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber spends her mornings getting dressed and buying various items from tradesmen who flock to her apartment, while her waiting-woman, Nan, enjoys her newfound success and popularity.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber indulges in her extravagant lifestyle, buying more luxurious items and enjoying the attention of tradesmen. However, her excessive spending and disregard for her husband's absence may lead to consequences in her relationships and financial situation.

author: Kathleen Winsor

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Lady Stanhope questions Amber about her son, Gerald, and is horrified to learn that he has not been visiting Amber since her arrival. Amber confronts her mother-in-law about using her funds for personal gain, escalating the tension between them.

Amber and Bruce have an emotional encounter where Bruce reveals that he is married to another woman, leaving Amber devastated and angry. Amber spends her mornings getting dressed and buying various items from tradesmen who flock to her apartment, while her waiting-woman, Nan, enjoys her newfound success and popularity. Amber is in her apartment, surrounded by various items she has bought from tradesmen, when her mother-in-law, Lady Stanhope, unexpectedly arrives. Amber is shocked by Lady Stanhope's extravagant appearance and realizes that her mother-in-law has spent her money on her own lavish attire. Amber laces her waist tightly to hide her growing pregnancy, while casually lying to her mother-in-law about her relationship with Gerald. Lady Stanhope expresses her disapproval and plans to confront Gerald about neglecting his wife. Amber's mother-in-law, Lady Stanhope, arrives unexpectedly and expresses her disapproval of Amber and Gerald living apart. Gerald Stanhope challenges Bruce to a duel, but Bruce apologizes and Gerald accepts, leaving Amber shocked and disappointed. Bruce tells Amber about his life in Virginia, describing the abundance of nature and his plans to build a home there. Amber and Bruce are in bed when they hear the sound of drums and shouts, signaling that the Dutch have invaded London. Amber's husband Bruce prepares to leave London to fight against the Dutch invasion, despite her pleas for him to stay. Amber refuses to leave London during the Dutch invasion, insisting on staying to be able to hear from her husband Bruce if he gets hurt, while her mother-in-law, Lady Stanhope, prepares to leave for the country. Amber, tired and worried, arrives at Newbold's house and demands her money, but is informed that the goldsmith cannot return it immediately due to the financial chaos caused by the invasion.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber and Bruce have a conversation about their son, Bruce's plans to take him away, and the implications of his upbringing. Amber initially refuses to consider it, but eventually agrees to let their son go with Bruce.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Bruce leaves with their son, causing Amber to grapple with the pain of separation and the fear of being forgotten. She continues to navigate her relationships and the chaos of the Dutch invasion.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber decides to go to America with Bruce and their son, hoping that it will keep her alive in Bruce's memory, and they say their emotional goodbyes as Bruce and their son board the ship.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Lady Stanhope confronts Gerald about neglecting his wife, causing tension between them. Amber struggles with her feelings of despair and loneliness as she watches the ship carrying Bruce and their son sail away.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: The Duke of Buckingham sends a young boy to the Tower to inform the sentry that he is waiting at the Sun Tavern to be arrested. He enjoys his dinner while a crowd gathers outside, cheering for him.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: The Duke of Buckingham is taken into custody and brought to trial, where he faces the possibility of losing his head. Despite the odds against him, Buckingham remains confident and defiant, believing that he will be acquitted and released.
recaptext: Amber, a young woman in London, faces a series of unfortunate events and ends up in prison. Frances reveals her affair, Barbara seeks help in determining the father of her child, and Charles plans to gather evidence against Buckingham. Amber, now married to Gerald Stanhope, attends a ball to assert her social status. Lady Stanhope receives a letter informing her that her son, Gerald, has married the former Countess of Radclyffe but they are not living together. Concerned, Lady Stanhope meets her new daughter-in-law, Amber, and disapproves of their living arrangement. Lady Stanhope offers Amber a place to stay in London, and Amber reluctantly accepts. As Amber navigates her pregnancy and her strained relationship with Gerald, she forms a connection with Bruce, who is married to another woman. When the Dutch invade London, Bruce prepares to leave to fight, while Amber refuses to leave in case she hears from him. Eventually, Amber decides to go to America with Bruce and their son, bidding an emotional farewell.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara, the Countess, encounters a beggar who gives her a folded paper and warns her about the Duke of Buckingham's impending downfall.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Barbara confronts the King about Buckingham's innocence, but Charles dismisses her and insults her. Enraged, Barbara insults the King in public, causing a scene and attracting attention from onlookers.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Lady Stanhope disapproves of Amber's living arrangement with her son Gerald and offers her a place to stay in London. Amber settles into her new apartments at Whitehall, becoming a Lady of the Bedchamber and gaining access to the King's apartments through a secret passage.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber confronts Lucilla about the accusations and defends herself, asserting her independence and challenging Lucilla's hypocrisy. Lucilla threatens legal action against Amber, leading to a confrontation.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber gives Lady Stanhope a furious ultimatum and collapses into a chair, overwhelmed by the dark morbidity of her pregnancy. Dr. Fraser delivers Amber's long, thin baby, and Charles visits the newborn and remarks on the baby's resemblance to himself. Gerald, dressed as a fop, awkwardly meets the baby and leaves abruptly to attend the play.

title: Forever Amber
author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber faces the challenges of motherhood and her strained relationship with Gerald and Lucilla. She grapples with her feelings for Bruce and considers the possibility of pursuing a relationship with him.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber plans to find a husband for her troublesome mother-in-law, Lucilla, who is attracted to a young fop named Sir Frederick Fothergill.

author: Kathleen Winsor
text: Amber convinces Sir Frederick to marry Lucilla to solve his financial problems, but their marriage is filled with tension and Lucilla's flirtatious behavior continues to cause problems.
